messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Bewildering Bank Break-in DATE: 03/03/66 The courtroom was a spectacle of suspense as the trial unraveled. The prosecution summoned the officers crucial to the investigation to shed light on their discoveries. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Lieutenant A. B. Adams, the head investigator of this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Lieutenant Adams. Can you detail the events on the afternoon the break-in was detected? WITNESS: Certainly. On the afternoon of May 5th, Officer C. D. Clark found the back door of the bank ajar and reported it. We initiated the investigation immediately. PROSECUTOR: Who oversaw the forensic examination? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Evans and Technician G. H. Hill were in charge of the forensic examination. PROSECUTOR: Who carried out the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Jackson and K. L. Lewis managed the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense began a rigorous cross-examination of Lieutenant Adams concerning the investigative procedures. During the trial, Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson, Patrol Officer O. P. Owen, and Patrol Officer Q. R. Quinn were also brought to the stand.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lieutenant A. B. Adams 
Officer Context: Lieutenant Adams is the head investigator in the Bewildering Bank Break-in case, explaining the events on the afternoon the break-in was detected during the trial. 
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Clark 
Officer Context: Officer Clark discovered the back door of the bank ajar on the afternoon of May 5th, which initiated the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Evans 
Officer Context: Sergeant Evans, alongside Technician G. H. Hill, was responsible for overseeing the forensic examination related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Hill 
Officer Context: Technician Hill worked with Sergeant E. F. Evans on the forensic analysis concerning the bank break-in. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Jackson 
Officer Context: Detective Jackson, alongside Detective K. L. Lewis, managed the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the break-in. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. Lewis 
Officer Context: Detective Lewis, along with Detective I. J. Jackson, was tasked with interrogating individuals to collect additional information about the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Nelson was brought to the stand to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer O. P. Owen 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Owen was also brought to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer Q. R. Quinn 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Quinn was summoned to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer
